Download Workrave development releases

The version 1.10 development releases are based on the stable 1.10 release.

The ‘Next’ development releases of Workrave are a preview of an upcoming new release of Workrave (probably version 1.12). This release has seen a lot of internal cleanup and code modernization, but very few new features. The most interesting change in the ‘Next’ release is a port to macOS using Qt5. This port is not yet ready.

Note that the ‘Next’ release did not get as much testing as the official 1.10 release and may be less stable.

  • Workrave 1.10
  • Workrave 'Next'

GitHub Merge pull request #185 from kenhys/use-ayatana-for-v1_10

Use libayatana-indicator3 instead of libindicator3
commit 5ee6813c22f6a92b224a763617ac7f581ef3a4fd
Author: Kentaro Hayashi
Date: Apr 29 2020, 04:52:50 UTC

Use libayatana-indicator3 instead of libindicator3

The libindicator package is deprecated in Debian. Applications
depending on it are expected to switch over to the fork (maintained
upstream and downstream): "libayatana-indicator".

libayatana-indicator is compatible successor library for libindicator.

ref. https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=895038
commit b88152d0030f8fbffb45f66ac53f5fdee5050ea1
Author: albanobattistella
Date: Apr 27 2020, 10:54:07 UTC

GitHub Merge pull request #97 from mrexodia/v1_10-cmake-windows

Fix compilation and linking errors on Windows with CMake
commit c8358e06e75e607a5b88cc9d73789f4d5b910219
Author: Duncan Ogilvie
Date: Mar 13 2018, 22:31:55 UTC

Fix compilation and linking errors on Windows with CMake

- ghmac.c did not compile on MSVC because of missing casts.
- ghmac.c and W32Shutdown.cc were not included in the CMakeLists.
- README contained wrong steps on gettext/intltool dependency detection.
- debug.hh did not include <string> causing compilation errors.
- dxerr8.h does not exist in the advertised DirectX 9 SDK.
- Certain symbols do not exist in the MSVC SDK.
- W32Shutdown::shutdown did not return a value.

GitHub Merge pull request #81 from mitya57/branch_v1_10

Multiple improvements for the GNOME Panel applet
commit 0c090dc635bfb677f32920cef7de389c76ae9253
Author: Rob Caelers
Date: Nov 4 2016, 20:17:46 UTC

Fix gtk2 build

Signed-off-by: Rob Caelers <rob.caelers@gmail.com>
commit 836f30cbfc5c680852de8457a97de931e01d9b02
Author: Dmitry Shachnev
Date: Nov 4 2016, 17:42:09 UTC

Multiple improvements for the GNOME Panel applet

* Make it build with the recently released libpanel-applet 3.22:
- Convert from out-of-process applet to in-process applet.
- Do not use panel_applet_set_background_widget() function.
- Instead, depend on libpanel-applet ≥ 3.16 where this function
is no longer needed.
- Get the applets directory from pkg-config instead of using the
hard-coded path (fix the existing pkg-config call).
* Also, fix the compiler warnings about implicitly declared functions.

Merge pull request #79 from tradesmanhelix/patch-1

Fix AC_PROG_LIBTOOL Error
commit 7afed139da47855bc71343529ae098652ced45b4
Author: Alex Smith
Date: Jun 7 2016, 16:07:01 UTC

Fix AC_PROG_LIBTOOL Error

Fix error where `./autogen.sh` would fail with a message about `AC_PROG_LIBTOOL` and `m4_pattern_allow`. Turns out, this is due to `libtool` not being installed on the system, so added `libtool` to list of dependencies.

Merge pull request #52 from geckoneer/cleanup-m4

Cleanup autogenerated files
commit 213f9b10af8d2bb58ca240825f87db9ccb8bad5f
Author: Denis Nikolaenko
Date: Oct 24 2015, 02:43:04 UTC

Rearanged vertical separator in statistics dialog
commit db6e34aa73e4cf578aa02c0afbc85c64d545501b
Author: Denis Nikolaenko
Date: Oct 24 2015, 01:42:16 UTC

Show monthly usage in statistics
commit f77bcfa71b290596edae1d365133db62c3ca3e3a
Author: Denis Nikolaenko
Date: Oct 23 2015, 20:19:24 UTC

document Autoconf Macro Archive as a requirement

The macro AX_CXX_COMPILE_STDCXX_11 is a part of Autoconf Macro Archive
and was commited verbatim before.
In order to keep git changelogs more sane, all m4/*.m4 files were deleted.
Now you need this macro to come from Autoconf Macro Archive.
The macro first appeared in version 2012.04.04 of the archive.
Initially it had only one parameter. The second parameter which was specified as
[mandatory] before this commit is the default and can be safely ommitted for
compatibility.
commit 8a631b2f359d78353fed28957b32a2a637765863
Author: Denis Nikolaenko
Date: Oct 23 2015, 19:52:25 UTC

deleted and .gitignore(d) autogenerated files

You may need to run
./autogen.sh; ./configure; make
to regenereate *.m4 files which should not have been
under version control in the first place
commit f10cec7fc96969e43fd595035f8a51052ee9cf04

commit 77e09d41ca180db3cea0b44f7eda895678010de1
Author: Mateusz Jończyk
Date: Feb 15 2014, 21:03:40 UTC

Improved support for locking the screen

It now works on most desktop environments, prefers D-Bus instead
of executing raw commands and the code is much better organized.

The code now supports two general methods of suspending: via DBus
(implemented in ScreenLockDBus.??) and via CommandLine
(implemented in ScreenLockCommandline.??).
Both classes inherit from a single interface: IScreenLockMethod.

Windows screen locking support is integrated in a separate commit.

The code was tested on Unity, Gnome3, KDE, Xfce, LXDE and i3 as of
Ubuntu 12.04.
commit af6f1b512d3ecb0558ca944bfb9da905800a2ea0
Author: Mateusz Jończyk
Date: Feb 14 2014, 14:29:04 UTC

Added class DBusProxy for easy DBus method invocation.

commit 64d5ddf91f1d38dd4882f8f95b1e9591dacac35a
Author: Liu DongMiao
Date: Jan 7 2014, 11:16:51 UTC

fix memory leak when play sound.

I find this issue for very long time.
However, I didn't find a good way to fix it.
Now, I use a bad way to do this.

As QTKIT/QUICKTIME is depreceated in OSX, I change to NSSound.
I keep an dictionary for the sound file and NSSound object to avoid
new instance for NSSound every time.

Fix build on OSX, eggsmclient-osx.c must be compied in objective-c mode.

revert change on ce3af909b5cb5c7ce0a67b5ac4d7a81b457950b7
@robc, why that commit is named `Fix build on non-OSX`

`frontend/gtkmm/src/eggsmclient-osx.c` must be compied in objective-c mode.
However, the `AM_CPFLAGS` apply on it, so `CFLAGS` is used as hack for .c.o.

commit 15f09d8a626e0c1251adc842e5cc5ed05a4cb690
Author: Sébastien Villemot
Date: Sep 1 2013, 19:44:29 UTC

Fixed bug 1120: make the GNOME shell extension compatible with GNOME 3.8

The D-Bus Glib bindings, which were deprecated since GNOME 3.4, have been
removed in GNOME 3.8. This commit replaces them by the new Gio bindings.

Release 1.10

Signed-off-by: Rob Caelers <robc@krandor.org>
commit 2ff9f277ae4d33aeab33f5a495e1fa5266585f1d
Author: Rob Caelers
Date: Jan 8 2013, 18:04:28 UTC

Fix spacing in HigCategoryPanel.

Signed-off-by: Rob Caelers <robc@krandor.org>
commit 6f9bc5d9d66c6042923ca39367f54db39ecd914a
Author: Rob Caelers
Date: Jan 7 2013, 17:13:06 UTC

Force BreakWindow focus on start by default.

(Based on commit by Ray Satiro)

- (BreakWindow::BreakWindow)
Enable force_focus_on_break_start by default.

- (W32ForceFocus::GetFunctions)
Use AttachInput() and MinimizeRestore() by default to steal the focus.

Prior to these changes Windows could stop Workrave's BreakWindow from
becoming the foreground window. This is by design in Windows. For more
information refer to the SetForegroundWindow() MSDN documentation.

commit 8da281b148f0a08da8c0872cdb74cd9742fb2e09
Author: eteeselink
Date: Dec 5 2012, 17:51:58 UTC

commit ef30b4feee148810bf27f465672cf5005e351fbe
Author: eteeselink
Date: Dec 5 2012, 17:51:08 UTC

Made behaviour of 'skippable' and 'ignorable' make a bit more sane. 'ignorable' now means "show postpone button". 'skippable' means "show skip button". They're not interdependent anymore.
commit 2efa1b0b23ae2a22e64f0dc3a1482ce065077143
Author: eteeselink
Date: Dec 5 2012, 17:46:41 UTC

Split "show 'postpone' and 'skip'" checkbox into two checkboxes.
commit c9eb4bb26443dd35cebe5820fb054e89b402cbec
Author: teeselinke
Date: Dec 5 2012, 12:53:26 UTC

Removed "skippable" check in user initiated breaks, to keep an escape in case the 'take break now' button was accidentally clicked. Also matched indenting style to rest of the code.
commit b6901f4db56b375bf32b324e690280b42791e25c
Author: teeselinke
Date: Dec 5 2012, 10:53:41 UTC

Added a "break_skippable" config key which, when set to zero, disables the "skip" button. This key can only be set by manually editing the configuration (e.g. by using regedit when on Windows), not through the Preferences screen.

(partly) fix make distcheck.

Signed-off-by: Rob Caelers <robc@krandor.org>
commit 20bf0c897f1174b1b36e76624cd9545eceb03a23
Author: Rob Caelers
Date: Nov 3 2012, 17:27:10 UTC

Bug 1087: change insensitive mode on all breaks.
commit 93b3aa749d0f951f52b9a80395cfc591b9924bd3
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Oct 7 2012, 06:36:29 UTC

Check for visible tooltip during w32 break refresh

frontend/gtkmm/src/GtkUtil.cc
frontend/gtkmm/src/GtkUtil.hh
frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32Compat.cc

- (GtkUtil::get_visible_tooltip_window)
New function to get the application's visible tooltip window.

- (W32Compat::RefreshBreakWindow)
Don't enforce topmost while a tooltip is visible.

Prior to this change any break window tooltip was visible only very
briefly. Any tooltip would be quickly covered by the break window
because we were forcing our break window to become topmost over any
other window, including our topmost tooltip window.
commit c95dda4772801a9b0f27593fecfbd69b457e79fb
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Oct 7 2012, 06:11:44 UTC

Move w32 refresh from BreakWindow to W32Compat

frontend/gtkmm/src/BreakWindow.cc
frontend/gtkmm/src/BreakWindow.hh
frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32Compat.cc
frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32Compat.hh

- (BreakWindow)
Add W32Compat class as a friend of BreakWindow.

- (BreakWindow::refresh)
Move the w32 specific code to W32Compat::RefreshBreakWindow().

- (W32Compat::RefreshBreakWindow)
New function for our w32 code from BreakWindow::refresh().
commit 6b595f6a1fec19f9f880aaed928af9d26d540d66
Author: Rob Caelers
Date: Sep 30 2012, 11:50:11 UTC

Fix prelude window frame color.

Signed-off-by: Rob Caelers <robc@krandor.org>
commit e879950cd4d3b8123da88d6cf7cf406460b2e89b
Author: Rob Caelers
Date: Sep 30 2012, 11:45:46 UTC

Update gnome-shell/unity versions

Signed-off-by: Rob Caelers <robc@krandor.org>
commit dfb2711fc390879927ba7470c809e052c9b79e87
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Sep 29 2012, 06:46:41 UTC

Add w32 topmost call in BreakWindow::refresh()

frontend/gtkmm/src/BreakWindow.cc

- (BreakWindow::refresh)
Add a call to SetWindowPos() with HWND_TOPMOST to ensure that our break
window stays topmost even over other topmost windows.

Prior to this change the call to W32Compat::SetWindowOnTop() --which
is similar to what is described above-- in BreakWindow::refresh() was
eliminated for compatibility with W32 force focus behavior.
Ref: e5df39fb31b10745697406ebe2dc7c4283a75d05

All of the behavior of W32Compat::SetWindowOnTop() is now in
BreakWindow::refresh() and is modified to be force focus compatible.
commit 92c6ace10f8872c8399b18516884375f6b8533ea
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Sep 29 2012, 06:09:00 UTC

Change W32ForceFocus::MinimizeRestore() method

frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32ForceFocus.cc

- (W32ForceFocus::MinimizeRestore)
Change dummy window coordinates to off screen.
Change ShowWindow() calls to SetWindowPlacement() calls.

Prior to these changes the dummy window could be visible to the user
during the brief moment when it was minimized and restored. It was very
apparent on XP if using its default window theme.
commit 66d011d9199d19a0d2383059e3790b13e167389a
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Sep 29 2012, 04:06:40 UTC

Fix minor bug in W32Compat::IsOurDesktopVisible()

frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32Compat.cc

- (W32Compat::IsOurDesktopVisible)
Fix incorrect buffer size comparisons of bytes needed to max characters.

Prior to this change the incorrect comparisons would cause the function
to fail if the bytes needed for a buffer was more than half its size.
commit 1a62a97d27b59c31275fcddb96d4879482089be1
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Sep 27 2012, 06:12:11 UTC

Add W32 function GetForegroundWindowTryHarder()

frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32ForceFocus.cc
frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32ForceFocus.hh

- (W32ForceFocus::GetForegroundWindowTryHarder)
New function to retry GetForegroundWindow() a number of times.

- (W32ForceFocus::AltKeypress)
- (W32ForceFocus::AttachInput)
- (W32ForceFocus::MinimizeRestore)
Use GetForegroundWindowTryHarder() instead of GetForegroundWindow() for
more accurate results.

Prior to this change the three force focus functions above would test
for the current foreground window by calling GetForegroundWindow().
Occasionally that call would return NULL because the window manager was
in the middle of a transition from one foreground window to another. To
remedy that I've implemented GetForegroundWindowTryHarder().
commit 95b6fe42c5267da9b48a56519cd01eef3cc8f693
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Sep 25 2012, 05:08:00 UTC

Add W32 functions to check winstation status

frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32Compat.cc
frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32Compat.hh
frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32ForceFocus.cc

- (W32Compat::_init)
Refactor W32Compat initialization.

- (W32Compat::WinStationQueryInformationW)
New function to query winstation information.

- (W32Compat::IsOurWinStationConnected)
New function to check if our process' window station is connected.

- (W32Compat::IsOurWinStationLocked)
New function to check if our process' window station is locked.

- (W32Compat::IsOurDesktopVisible)
New function to check if our thread's desktop is viewable by the user.
If the desktop is viewable then the window station associated with our
process is connected, unlocked and our desktop receives the input.

- (W32ForceFocus::thread_Worker)
Do not try to force the window focus if our desktop is not visible.
commit 17d99f6ac1e1b25ccd5b7087e6aa5d38ad896472
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Sep 24 2012, 04:28:56 UTC

Fix minor bug in W32CriticalSection::AdvancedGuard

common/include/win32/W32CriticalSection.hh
common/src/win32/W32CriticalSection.cc

- (W32CriticalSection::AdvancedGuard::TryLockFor)
Add acceptance of INFINITE as a remaining wait time: Update the
remaining wait time only if not INFINITE.

Prior to this change an infinite wait was not handled properly.
commit e5df39fb31b10745697406ebe2dc7c4283a75d05
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Sep 23 2012, 07:11:40 UTC

Adjust BreakWindow::refresh() for W32ForceFocus

frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32ForceFocus.cc

- (BreakWindow::refresh)
Remove WindowHints::set_always_on_top() from the W32 section. That call
does not behave as desired if there are multiple break windows and
force_focus is enabled. Instead add a call to W32Compat::ResetWindow()
to ensure we hold topmost.

- (BreakWindow::refresh)
Remove the logic to call W32Compat::ResetWindow() for every mode except
GUIConfig::BLOCK_MODE_NONE. Instead call the function always. Even if
there's no block mode a topmost window may still need a reset.

- (BreakWindow::refresh)
Call W32ForceFocus::ForceWindowFocus() only if the advanced/force_focus
preference is enabled and the BreakWindow we're forcing focus to is the
main break window.

Prior to these changes if the user had advanced/force_focus enabled and
there were multiple break windows active then focus was forced to each
of them on each refresh(), resulting in a continuous round-robin change
of the foreground window and making it very difficult for the user to
interact with Workrave during a break.
commit d165eaea86d38710200699ed65103c82cdf12a08
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Sep 20 2012, 06:52:37 UTC

Add critical sections to W32ForceFocus functions

frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32ForceFocus.cc
frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32ForceFocus.hh

- (W32ForceFocus::GetFunctions)
Add a critical section to cache function retval.

- (W32ForceFocus::GetForceFocusValue)
Add a critical section to cache function retval.
commit 10c98083ff5f69dba980b25880786520ffa9d952
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Sep 20 2012, 06:36:04 UTC

New W32CriticalSection class for RAII sections

build/cmake/common/CMakeLists.txt
common/include/win32/W32CriticalSection.hh
common/src/win32/W32CriticalSection.cc

- New class W32CriticalSection

An RAII wrapper for Microsoft's CRITICAL_SECTION thread synchronization
object that handles the initialization, locking/unlocking and deletion.
The locking is thread re-entrant, unlike Microsoft's own
critical_section class which is not.

For more see comment block in common/src/win32/W32CriticalSection.cc
commit 40a05cb9308cfb4ba0a4b7b3809cc5c26d846520
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Sep 16 2012, 06:41:24 UTC

New W32ForceFocus class to force window focus

build/cmake/frontend/CMakeLists.txt
frontend/gtkmm/src/BreakWindow.cc
frontend/gtkmm/src/BreakWindow.hh
frontend/gtkmm/src/RestBreakWindow.cc
frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32Compat.cc
frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32Compat.hh
frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32ForceFocus.cc
frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32ForceFocus.hh

- Abolish existing win32 force focus code in W32Compat

- New class W32ForceFocus

The new class contains several different hacks to force win32 window
focus. Each hack is contained in its own function. 3 are implemented:

AltKeypress(): Simulate an ALT keypress to force focus
AttachInput(): Attach to the foreground thread to force focus
MinimizeRestore(): Minimize and restore a dummy window to force focus

AttachInput() is a rewrite of the force focus method that was in
W32Compat, and the other two are new. Each of the functions can spin
their trick in an attempt to make the passed in hwnd (eg a Workrave
break window) the foreground window.

Although the focus functions are public it is not always safe to call
them directly, as at least one of them -- AttachInput() -- could
deadlock our GUI main thread. Instead call ForceWindowFocus(), which
creates a sacrificial worker thread to call the focus functions.


- New preference: advanced/force_focus_functions

As described above we have several functions that can be used to force
the focus. This preference determines which of those functions will be
called by the thread started by ForceWindowFocus(). If the preference
does not exist then all functions are tried. The preference consists of
one or more names separated by a comma with no spaces. The order is not
important (subject to change). The names match to the focus functions'
enumerated names:

all_functions,
no_functions,
alt_keypress,
attach_input,
minimize_restore

When all_functions is encountered then all functions will always be
tried. When no_functions is encountered then no functions will be tried
aside from a vanilla SetForegroundWindow().

The REG_SZ preference is evaluated internally as a string. Example:
[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Workrave\advanced]
"force_focus_functions"="minimize_restore,attach_input"


- New preference: advanced/force_focus_on_break_start

This is a lighter alternative to advanced/force_focus that shouldn't
cause any disruption. On BreakWindow::BreakWindow() this preference is
read and cached locally as bool force_focus_on_break_start, and on
BreakWindow::start() we call W32ForceFocus::ForceWindowFocus() if
we're forcing focus on start.

Background:

We have to make sure our break windows are set on top with every call
to BreakWindow::refresh(), however if advanced/force_focus is enabled
then each call to set our window on top results in focus being forced
to that window. Depending on the method that could cause flickering,
simulated input, or any number of other undesirables. While I've made
changes to mitigate this in the codebase we can also now virtually
eliminate it by only attempting to force the focus once, on break start.

The REG_SZ preference is evaluated internally as boolean. Example:
[HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Workrave\advanced]
"force_focus_on_break_start"="1"
commit 00d40b8c3605da321244ba95a0171dcf1407a8d5
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Sep 5 2012, 01:28:49 UTC

Remove legacy code from W32Compat

frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/DesktopWindow.cc
frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32Compat.cc
frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32Compat.hh

- Remove legacy code
The W32Compat class was written eight years ago when Win 9x
compatibility was still an issue. Many of the Win2k+ functions had to
be acquired dynamically, and that's no longer necessary.

Fix bug in cmake image files install

build/cmake/frontend/CMakeLists.txt

- Use DIRECTORY keyword to preserve the directory structure of the
share\images directory.

This fixes a bug where prior to this change the directory structure was
not preserved and each different size of workrave.png ended up being
overwritten by the prior when building INSTALL. Now each workrave.png
remains in its respective directory (eg share\images\48x48\workrave.png)
commit 4530ebe74a90a88d84360273629a1d74dc39f39a
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Jun 29 2012, 05:28:41 UTC

Change harpoonHelper project to use static CRT

common/win32/buildone.cmd
common/win32/harpoonHelper/src/harpoonHelper.vcproj

- (buildone.cmd)
Enable command processor extensions (ENABLEEXTENSIONS) and delayed
environment variable expansion (ENABLEDELAYEDEXPANSION).

On my systems with VS2008 and VS2010 I cannot run buildone.cmd
successfully without both of those options enabled. They are already
enabled in buildall.cmd.


- (harpoonHelper.vcproj)
Use the static release/debug CRT when building harpoonhelper.exe.

C++ code generation for the helper links to the release/debug CRT DLL
respectively depending on the configuration. A result of this is the
64-bit CRT DLL must be redistributed with Workrave because the version
required may not be on the user's computer already. That's a problem
because the helper is not in a separate directory where the 64-bit CRT
DLL can also be placed. The only CRT DLLs that should be placed in the
directory with workrave.exe are 32-bit types; there should be no 64-bit
types.

Other solutions would be move harpoonHelper.exe to a 64-bit directory
(eg something like %ProgramFiles%\Workrave\lib\x64) and include the
64-bit CRT DLL it was linked to, or include Microsoft's redist
installer for the 64-bit CRT DLL and have setup run it before install.

This is not currently a problem with the 64-bit applet or 64-bit
harpoon, both of which already link to the static CRT.
commit 3c3961041276bed21607061cb0ce76c045247c9c

Date: Jun 19 2012, 05:49:40 UTC

commit 2588eae32cc8223c1567810a6bf6d7c8ad147777
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Jun 1 2012, 07:05:28 UTC

New Win32 post-install autorun changer

common/src/win32/ChangeAutorun.c

- Standalone program that Active Setup can use to change a user's
autorun settings.

The installer can set an Active Setup key to run this program. This way
when each user logs on their autorun settings can be added or updated
or unmodified according to the settings chosen during install.

Currently the installer can only change the autorun settings for the
user running the installer. Using the Active Setup method
ChangeAutorun.exe can be run automatically and quietly by Windows
during each user's first logon after Workrave install.

For example the installer could offer an option to start Workrave
automatically for all users, or new users only.



Here is the output of ChangeAutorun /?


This is a configuration tool added by this project's installer.
This program is invoked by Microsoft's undocumented Active Setup.
If you do not understand what this program does don't use it.

ACTIVE_SETUP_GUID: {180B0AC5-6FDA-438B-9466-C9894322B6BA}
AUTORUN_VALUE: Workrave
PROJECT: Workrave
HKCU_PROJECT_KEY: AppEvents\Schemes\Apps\Workrave
TARGET: workrave.exe
TARGET_OPTIONS:

Options:
-a Add autorun always.
-b Add autorun only if user has never before used your project.
-d Remove the autorun entry.
-r Remove the Active Setup entry.
-u Update existing autorun entry.
-v Be verbose. If multiple arguments this must be the first.
-z Show each passed in argument for testing purposes.

The 'Add autorun' options are mutually exclusive. Using either
implies option 'u', which updates an existing autorun entry, if any.

Option 'r' removes the HKCU Active Setup entry, if any, and not the
HKLM Active Setup entry. What that means is Active Setup will be
reset for the user, and will run the next time the user logs on.
commit ccd50938c79d7d2e7048ff428f9db452092bc3bd
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Jun 1 2012, 06:33:36 UTC

common/include/win32/W32ActiveSetup.hh

Merge pull request #17 from jay/j

Fix null pointer delete in Statistics
commit d70db4366b9ef97d5446b23cb7bee913ce8cca79
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Jun 5 2012, 05:09:18 UTC

Fix sound theme defaults for new users

frontend/common/src/SoundPlayer.cc

- (SoundPlayer::activate_theme)
Do not check that the filename is not empty before testing it. An empty
filename will now fail validation the same as if the filename does not
exist.

Prior to this change a new user would not receive the default settings
of a sound profile. Here's what happened with the break prelude sound,
for example:

A new user doesn't have the following keys:
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\AppEvents\Schemes\Apps\Workrave-crash\WorkraveBreakPrelude\.current
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\AppEvents\Schemes\Apps\Workrave-crash\WorkraveBreakPrelude\.default

So Workrave sets
HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Workrave\sound\events\break_prelude as ""

Later activate_theme() is called by register_sound_events() and it
tests if break_prelude exists, and because it does it will not attempt
to set the filename. The filename, empty as "", will not fail
validation if it's empty.

As far as I know this was only a problem on Windows.
commit 36a7e3b7126e26c9243cb2954860f78ecd08705e
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Jun 5 2012, 04:35:15 UTC

Add cmake option to disable DBUS detection

build/cmake/CMakeLists.txt

- Add option to disable DBUS detection.
Append -DFIND_DBUS=OFF to your cmake command line to disable DBUS.

Prior to this change DBUS if found was always enabled for the project.

commit 972b9d97e9a4082b28a28c0abbcba06a05ae0bd4
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Apr 10 2012, 02:45:12 UTC

Rename Serbian translation file

po/LINGUAS
po/sr@latin.po

- Rename rs.po to sr@latin.po.

Serbia has a country code of 'RS' and a language code of 'sr'.
One might assume 'sr_RS' but from what I've seen that is supposed to be
cyrillic. My gtkmm uses 'sr' for cyrillic and 'sr@latin' for latin, so
I'm keeping with that convention. Also see
http://www.gnu.org/savannah-checkouts/gnu/gettext/manual/html_node/Locale-Names.html
http://trac.wxwidgets.org/ticket/10295
commit 6d277454e27e831264f287da10a4ba015bb3f28f

commit f5731ca154f2cf1531a6b2963636209ee1503212

Date: Apr 4 2012, 18:17:32 UTC

Merge pull request #13 from jay/w32_dev_locale

Check MSVC build directory for locale info
commit 7f6ec007697410fe44db0292958ab2c09db08200
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Apr 4 2012, 06:44:04 UTC

Add the capability to delete all stored statistics

backend/include/IStatistics.hh
backend/src/Statistics.cc
backend/src/Statistics.hh
frontend/plugin/statistics/gtkmm/src/StatisticsDialog.cc
frontend/plugin/statistics/gtkmm/src/StatisticsDialog.hh

commit fda34b3729108b548a8684ada6fec10992e48490
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Apr 4 2012, 04:58:53 UTC

Check MSVC build directory for locale info

frontend/gtkmm/src/GUI.cc

- (GUI::init_nls)
Use the pre-install locale location if workrave is running from its MSVC
build directory.

Example- Dev locale:
X:\Workrave\bernieri\workrave-build\bin\Debug\workrave.exe
X:\Workrave\bernieri\workrave-build\frontend
Example- Installed locale:
X:\Workrave\bernieri\workrave-install\lib\workrave.exe
X:\Workrave\bernieri\workrave-install\lib\locale

commit 6b9ac54ceb45ea00847d7437116be393cc0de8a1
Author: Rob Caelers
Date: Apr 3 2012, 18:15:38 UTC

Merge pull request #11 from jay/override

Rewrite OperationMode override behavior
commit 064a7c025996efb1df0a0ecbdb47afbde27e6a35
Author: Rob Caelers
Date: Apr 3 2012, 18:05:22 UTC

Fix crash on exit.
commit 0ed9e952672200da166e493dd4b1a8afce18b060
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Apr 3 2012, 07:41:57 UTC

Check MenuItems' active state before setting

frontend/gtkmm/src/MainGtkMenu.cc

- (MainGtkMenu::resync)
Call set_active() on some CheckMenuItems only if they are not already
in the desired state.

Each time the resync() function was called it would set items active
even if they were already active. That resulted in unnecessary signals
which resulted in unnecessary traffic; in particular a lot of
unnecessary calls to Core::set_operation_mode().
commit 81d78dfd4db7704591a23bbbcbf5d9e8737c69df
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Apr 3 2012, 07:29:07 UTC

Rewrite OperationMode override behavior

backend/include/ICore.hh
backend/src/Core.cc
backend/src/Core.hh
frontend/gtkmm/src/Menus.cc
frontend/gtkmm/src/PreferencesDialog.cc
frontend/gtkmm/src/Session.cc
frontend/gtkmm/src/StatusIcon.cc

This is a rewrite of the OperationMode override behavior.

Among the significant changes:

Proper handling of multiple overrides at the same time.

Any override operation mode is more important than any regular
operation mode. For example OPERATION_MODE_NORMAL as an override will
override a regular operation mode of OPERATION_MODE_SUSPENDED, and as a
result the active operation mode (var operation_mode) will be normal.

The operation mode overrides are valued in order of importance:
OPERATION_MODE_SUSPENDED, OPERATION_MODE_QUIET, OPERATION_MODE_NORMAL.
For example OPERATION_MODE_SUSPENDED as an override is more important
than OPERATION_MODE_QUIET as an override. If both overrides are in the
queue then the active operation mode (var operation_mode) will be
suspended.

Proper maintaining and restoring of the last regular operation mode.
Also the user can set an operation mode while an override is in place.
In any case the regular operation mode will be restored and set active
once all overrides are lifted.

Any overridden operation mode is no longer reflected in the status icon
or 'Mode' popup menu entries. That was the result of a design decision
to not call core_event_operation_mode_changed() during an override.
That function in turn would likely cause other signals that could cause
unwanted reentrancy and potentially adversely affect current operations
or the restoration of regular operation. This change may also eliminate
user confusion.

Merge pull request #10 from jay/cmake-changes

CMake changes and fixes
commit a9e75d6db04267c43679a5ebf7c2e0d43998001c
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Mar 4 2012, 07:39:47 UTC

Add cmake option to allow fuzzy translations

build/cmake/frontend/CMakeLists.txt

- Allow fuzzy translations for select languages.

To enable fuzzy translations for a language, for example Italian and
German, pass to cmake a colon separated list: -DLANG_FUZZY:STRING=it;de

To disable in a later cmake call make sure to clear the LANG_FUZZY
cache value: -ULANG_FUZZY
commit f124d3a2227f9daacc903ff7b098b6dc4e188326
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Mar 4 2012, 07:33:22 UTC

Fix cmake win32 locale install dir

build/cmake/frontend/CMakeLists.txt

- Use locale dir lib/locale instead of share/locale on WIN32.
GUI::init_nls() has gettext bind to lib/locale if the platform is win32,
but cmake was installing to share/locale prior to this change.
commit b223423014cc0ca6e761e99e67360f9e08146d02
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Mar 3 2012, 21:29:42 UTC

Change language awareness in cmake config

build/cmake/CMakeLists.txt
build/cmake/config.h.cmake
build/cmake/frontend/CMakeLists.txt

- Add HAVE_LANGUAGE_SELECTION define if WIN32.

- Change ALL_LINGUAS parsing.
Rather than have two copies of ALL_LINGUAS, one as a list and one as a
string, use the string in CMakeLists.txt and temporarily convert to a
list when needed by cmake to get languages. This change eliminates the
duplicate string in the config.h template. It now uses ${ALL_LINGUAS}.

commit 0586890ccd35bf29d5d329089f1e6703440c200c
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Feb 20 2012, 22:22:57 UTC

Move Win32 SetFocus() code in BreakWindow

frontend/gtkmm/src/BreakWindow.cc

- (BreakWindow::BreakWindow)
Bug: SetFocus() and SetWindowPos() were called before the window is
realized (before a valid HWND handle was in gobj()->window). The code
has been moved and they are now called after the window is realized.
commit c8b5ca45ba1a8a2ad3c8089cf9b2426703303802
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Feb 19 2012, 07:24:58 UTC

Fix thread termination in W32AlternateMonitor

backend/src/win32/W32AlternateMonitor.cc
backend/src/win32/W32AlternateMonitor.hh

- Remove legacy code
This class was written five years ago when Win 9x compatibility was
still an issue. GetLastInputInfo() had to be acquired dynamically, and
that's no longer necessary.

- Fix thread handling
The worker thread now waits on an event, thread_abort_event, to exit.
commit b62ae5007758cba2f8a1d79af9ec26231920493f
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Feb 15 2012, 21:49:12 UTC

commit 8e46af0cee1b6e093f19a9be295f4238d4b4a814
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Feb 15 2012, 07:29:13 UTC

Remove legacy code from W32LowLevelMonitor

backend/src/win32/W32LowLevelMonitor.cc
backend/src/win32/W32LowLevelMonitor.hh

- Remove legacy code
This class was written five years ago when Win 9x compatibility was
still an issue. Many of the Win2k+ functions had to be acquired
dynamically, and that's no longer necessary.

- Replace SwitchToThread() calls with Sleep(1)
Sleep(1) is a better yield here

Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master' into j
commit b7f7f8fd42726f91da88cb17e9341f209325bc50
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Feb 13 2012, 07:42:01 UTC

Fix W32AppletWindow errant worker threads

frontend/applets/win32/include/Applet.hh
frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32AppletWindow.cc
frontend/gtkmm/src/win32/W32AppletWindow.hh

- Redesign worker thread code to fix bug.

W32AppletWindow::set_enabled( bool enabled ) created a worker thread
each time it was called and enabled was true. That was incorrect.
The new code allows only a single worker thread for each instance of
the class. Once the worker thread is created it will continue to run
regardless of whether the applet is enabled, and waits on
heartbeat_data_event to send updates (as before).

Signed-off-by: Rob Caelers <robc@krandor.org>
commit 6c79cc9223574e3ab25d999283f1e2af4ec785ad
Author: Jay Satiro
Date: Feb 9 2012, 23:09:32 UTC

Update cmake build info

build/cmake/common/CMakeLists.txt
- Use DBus freedesktop source files. Maybe this should be
specific to (WIN32)? Now it's always using freedesktop src.

build/cmake/README
- Add links to additional required gettext dependencies.
- Add link to DirectX 9 SDK (June 2010) download page. The
DirectX SDK has since been integrated in the Windows SDK, but we
want this separate SDK.
- Note that the Python installer does not always add Python to
the PATH.
- Note that a reboot may be required if this is the user's first
time installing the dependencies. It's likely because explorer.exe
does not inherit the new PATH until after a reboot or some magic.

commit e7fa8534f248700011a74589fd0d271fae14a82c
Author: Kees-Jan Dijkzeul
Date: Dec 12 2010, 15:36:13 UTC

Optimized testconf.py

Testconf.py now writes out a makefile, allowing multiple workrave
configurations to be built in parallel.

To invoke, do something like:

make distclean
./testconf.py > testconf.mk && time make -f testconf.mk -j12 -k

Any failing builds will remain in their respective testconf/* directory
Succeeded builds will be cleaned out
commit 18a170cb123e091c044857f6a92c72408e97b174

GitHub Merge pull request #185 from kenhys/use-ayatana-for-v1_10

Use libayatana-indicator3 instead of libindicator3
commit 5ee6813c22f6a92b224a763617ac7f581ef3a4fd
Author: Kentaro Hayashi
Date: Apr 29 2020, 04:52:50 UTC

Use libayatana-indicator3 instead of libindicator3

The libindicator package is deprecated in Debian. Applications
depending on it are expected to switch over to the fork (maintained
upstream and downstream): "libayatana-indicator".

libayatana-indicator is compatible successor library for libindicator.

ref. https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=895038
commit b88152d0030f8fbffb45f66ac53f5fdee5050ea1
Author: albanobattistella
Date: Apr 27 2020, 10:54:07 UTC

GitHub Merge pull request #185 from kenhys/use-ayatana-for-v1_10

Use libayatana-indicator3 instead of libindicator3
commit 3c5ef886928d6168a5ef2d7b374358d9dd7f0c94
Author: Rob Caelers
Date: Apr 30 2020, 15:15:12 UTC

GitHub Merge pull request #184 from kenhys/use-ayatana

Use libayatana-indicator instead of libindicator
commit 5ee6813c22f6a92b224a763617ac7f581ef3a4fd
Author: Kentaro Hayashi
Date: Apr 29 2020, 04:52:50 UTC

Use libayatana-indicator3 instead of libindicator3

The libindicator package is deprecated in Debian. Applications
depending on it are expected to switch over to the fork (maintained
upstream and downstream): "libayatana-indicator".

libayatana-indicator is compatible successor library for libindicator.

ref. https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=895038
commit 84a21cff71cbba0ac321d215acb1e6b4d4efe195
Author: Kentaro Hayashi
Date: Apr 29 2020, 04:18:23 UTC

Use libayatana-indicator instead of libindicator

The libindicator package is deprecated in Debian. Applications
depending on it are expected to switch over to the fork (maintained
upstream and downstream): "libayatana-indicator".

libayatana-indicator is compatible successor library for libindicator.

ref. https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=895038
